author: Matt Bassil
description:
A Pokémon card that attendees of an event in Seoul, South Korea received for free is selling online for upwards of $60. The promo card is a mechanically unique Ditto featuring awesome art that shows this Pokémon mimic disguised as a bunch of other creatures, including a Pikachu and a Lapras.

Continue reading This free Korean Pokémon card featuring derpy Ditto is already selling for $60
MORE FROM WARGAMER:
title: This free Korean Pokémon card featuring derpy Ditto is already selling for $60

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Games Workshop has revealed the model for the new Knight Ruinator for Warhammer 40,000, a war mech built on the same corrupted chassis as the existing Chaos Knights, but armed with an inventively awful arsenal of original weapons. In stark contrast to the long range Imperial Knight Defender that the firm showed off last week, the Ruinator is armed with a huge breaching drill, a colossal flamethrower, and some armor piercing missiles for good measure.

Continue reading Warhammer 40k drops a daemon-tainted warmech with a flamethrower
MORE FROM WARGAMER
title: Warhammer 40k drops a daemon-tainted warmech with a flamethrower

author: Timothy Linward
description:
For just $18 (£14.04) you can get 35 books absolutely jam packed with behind the scenes info from all three Star Wars trilogies, the standalone movies Rogue One and Han Solo, and TV series including The Mandalorian and The Clone Wars. The Essential Star Wars Insider Collection is available right now on Humble Bundle, collecting almost fifty years of Jedi secrets from the pages of the famous Star Wars magazine.

Continue reading Become a Star Wars loremaster for under $20 with this stacked Humble Bundle
MORE FROM
title: Become a Star Wars loremaster for under $20 with this stacked Humble Bundle

author: Matt Bassil
description:
The MTG card Dark Confidant is quickly rising in price. The oldest variant of the card from Ravnica, City of Guilds has gone from $9 to $15 in just two days, but many of the different versions that have been printed over the years have also seen slight upticks.

According to MTG Goldfish, the Judge Promo copies have gone from $65 to $70, while more recent printings like Foundations or Ravnica Remastered are each up a couple of dollars.

Continue reading MTG card spikes as it returns to St
title: MTG card spikes as it returns to Standard for the first time in 20 years

author: Timothy Linward
description:
We Print Miniatures, a UK-based 3D printing firm that makes miniatures for use in tabletop RPGs like DnD or wargames like Warhammer, has laid down the law after receiving “an incredibly abusive email into customer service”. The firm posted a pledge to social media accounts promising that anyone sending abusive emails would have their orders cancelled and refunded, be banned from future purchases - and that continued abuse would be referred to the police.

Continue reading DnD mini-printing firm promises to call the cops on abusive customers
title: DnD mini-printing firm promises to call the cops on abusive customers

author: Mollie Russell
description:
The United States government announced on May 12 that it will temporarily suspend its 145% tariffs on Chinese imports. A 90-day agreement between the US and Chinese governments will lower the US tariffs on China to 30%, while China will impose a 10% tariff on American imports. For board game publishers, who have seen catastrophic consequences based on the ongoing trade war, this will be a welcome, though brief, bit of relief.

Continue reading Trump tariffs on China drop to 30%, offering board game creators temporary hope
MORE FROM WARGAMER:
title: Trump tariffs on China drop to 30%, offering board game creators temporary hope
